poem:
"Songs Born in the Shadows"

In the mournful hum of loss,
Paraorchestra finds a voice.
No single note of sorrow, this,
but a chorus of souls unabridged.
Disabled or non - all are heard,
each instrument a life in sound,
unmarred by the world's crude hand. 
Brett and Charles, in union, kind
curate a capsule, for time to remember,
that beauty can bloom, even in December.
